definition: radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
lit. ten thousand mile horse/fine steed
thousand jin 斤 (pounds) of gold/money and riches/(honorific) invaluable (support)/(honorific) daughter
for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive/once you've seen one, you've seen them all
Qiandao Lake in Zhejiang, aka Xin'an River Reservoir, created as part of a large hydroelectric project in 1959
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon

sentences.english: Zhang said the new goal could be 100GW by 2020.
sentences.chinese: 张晓强称，新的目标是2020年达到100千兆瓦。

sentences.english: That fire destroyed 38,000 acres and 21 homes.
sentences.chinese: 火火灾造成了3万8千英亩土地和21户住宅的损失。

sentences.english: One group ate food with 0.3 parts per million (ppm) methylmercury, which most U.
sentences.chinese: 第一组吃的食物中，甲基水银含量是千万分之三。

sentences.english: Wall Street economists had expected that the number would drop to 455, 000.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街经济学家原以为那个数字会将到45万5千的。

sentences.english: The acceleration needed to accomplish this implies ag-force of 14 million times Earth's gravity.
sentences.chinese: 而需要克服的加速度是重力加速度的1千4百万倍。

sentences.english: A thousand friends at the beginning of each card field encountered.
sentences.chinese: 每个会出千的朋友初入牌场时会碰到的。

sentences.english: A knight of the post bobbed a leatherhead on the street.
sentences.chinese: 一个站岗骑士在街上千了个磨碌。

sentences.english: And nearly 20-million hectares of crops are drying up.
sentences.chinese: 而且接近2千万公顷庄稼干枯了。

sentences.english: just over 1,000,000,000. In both India and China, the population is growing
sentences.chinese: 中国的人口大约是13亿2千8百万。

sentences.english: Liang Zihao folded He Ruoqian in his arms, with happiness flowing in his heart.
sentences.chinese: 梁子颢搂着何若千，幸福在他心里流动。

sentences.english: Crossing the mountains, trading tea and salt with antlers and musks.
sentences.chinese: 跨过了千山万岭，驮走鹿茸麝香，换来盐巴茶叶。

sentences.english: At that time the twelve hundred arhats, being free in mind, thought to themselves.
sentences.chinese: 尔时千二百阿罗汉心自在者作是念。

sentences.english: You can assemble lasagne 1 day ahead and chill, covered.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以将千层面提前1天作好，冷藏保存。

sentences.english: The casino if not a thousand words, is not ever-victorious general.
sentences.chinese: 赌场里如果不出千的话，是没有常胜将军的。

sentences.english: These 114m households will not be affected.
sentences.chinese: 这类为数达1亿1千4百万的家庭将不受影响。

sentences.english: A land bridge as much as 1,500 kilometers wide connected Asia and North America.
sentences.chinese: 一座宽达1千5百公里的大陆桥连接着亚洲和北美洲。

definition: abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
squad of five soldiers/to associate with/five (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
unit of area equal to 100 畝|亩[mu3] or 6.67 hectares/a short while/a little while ago/circa. (for approximate dates)
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
